DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Identify cancer patient low-risk inpatient meet criterion early discharge ( i.e. , symptomatic improvement temperature ≤ 37.8°C ) receive oral antibiotic febrile neutropenia . OUTLINE : This randomize , prospective , multicenter study . Patients stratify disease type ( lymphoma v solid tumor ) , duration registration ( < 48 hour vs > 48 hour ) , participate center . Patients receive oral amoxicillin-clavulanate potassium 3 time daily oral ciprofloxacin twice daily admission hospital . Treatment continue 7 day absence clinical deterioration unacceptable toxicity . Patients assess inpatient ≥ 24 72 hour first antibiotic dose . Patients show clear response ( i.e. , symptomatic improvement irrespective neutrophil recovery , temperature ≤ 37.8 C 24 hour ) continue meet study eligibility criterion randomize 1 2 arm . - Arm I ( early discharge ) : Patients discharge home instruct remain daily contact hospital staff report temperature symptoms completion oral antibiotic regimen . - Arm II ( standard management ) : Patients continue antibiotic course hospital discharge accord local guideline follow additional criterion : subjective improvement , afebrile ( ≤ 37°C 24 hour ) , absolute neutrophil count ≥ 500/mm³ rise . Patients arm complete daily diary document daily temperature reading , symptom , toxicity . Patients also complete Health Questionnaire Cancer Worries Inventory Booklet baseline , hospital immediately randomization , completion oral antibiotic resolution neutropenic febrile episode . Peer Reviewed Funded Endorsed Cancer Research UK PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 400 patient accrue study .
